newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA'S CARE DOWNGRADES DCL POLYESTERS.
newsitem.headline: INDIA'S CARE DOWNGRADES DCL POLYESTERS.

text.p: Credit Analysis & Research Ltd.(CARE) said on Thursday in a statement that it had downgraded the rating of the Non-Convertible Debenture Programme of 150 million rupees of DCL Polyesters (DCL), from CARE AA- Double A minus to CARE A- Single A minus.
DCL manufacturers partially oriented Polyester Filament Yarn (PFY) and has a total polymerisation capacity of 31,500 tonnes per annum.
Though capacity utilisation improved during 1996/97 (April-March), total income dropped from 2,862 million rupees in 1995/96 to 2,243 million rupees.
During 1996/97, the company's sales realisations were lower and with a high interest burden, DCL reported a net loss of 129 million rupees.

DCL expects a turnaround during 1997/98 because of improved sales realisations from PFY, steady raw material prices and higher sales of value added texturised yarn. DCL has also undertaken several measures to reduce cost.

With the reliefs in excise duty announced in the 1997/98 Union Budget, and better realisations of PFY in both international and domestic markets the outlook for the industry is expected to improve. However, in the medium term, the PFY industry is likely to continue to see domestic surpluses, intense competition and narrow margins.
